Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can include a fish in their drawing and label it correctly.
The student can illustrate and label the water environment where the fish lives, such as a lake, river, or ocean.
The student can show and label resources in the habitat that the fish needs, like water and any other elements in the water (e.g., aquatic plants or rocks).
The student can demonstrate how the fish and its environment work together, by showing how the habitat meets the needs of the fish (e.g., the fish swims in the water to get oxygen).
The student can show and label other plants or animals that might live in the same habitat as the fish, emphasizing their interactions in the ecosystem.
